value.title: Power Query, KPIs and thumbnails - Roundup #42
value.excerpt: A post on how to use Power Query to audit file changes. A look at KPIs within Power BI. Keeping up to date with Azure Active Directory Connect. And a post about how to use custom thumbnails for mobile reports in Reporting Services 2016. value.title: Power Query! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI
value.excerpt: Not a coder? Don't understand Power Query M syntax? Power Query can be fun, but also can turn complicated. Learning Power Query can make Power BI and Excel very rewarding. Adam has some resources to get you started in your journey.  Concept: Roche's Maxim https://ssbipolar.com/2021/05/31/roches-maxim/

value.title: PowerPoint, Auditing, OneDrive and more... - Roundup #59
value.excerpt: I was out last week, but am back! This week we had some information on how to use OneDrive for Business with Power BI, using Power BI inside of PowerPoint along with service updates for Power BI including the new Javascript API. value.title: Preventing Data Silos with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick and Kalyn look at data silos and how to prevent it using Power BI. Different options exist, such as Analysis Services, Azure Analysis Services or models hosted in the Power BI service.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Publish to Web got some awesome new updates in Power BI!

value.title: Push Power BI Apps To Users Explained

value.title: Query Folding, DAX and a special day - Roundup #55
value.excerpt: Chris Webb looks at how to use Value.ResourceExpression() to see how Query Folding is working. Marco Russo looks at how to leverage INTERSECT. We look at a post geared towards consultants and how they can leverage Shared Dashboards in their work. Also, there was a special day last sunday and we recap

value.title: Reduce the queries being sent with Incremental Refresh in Power BI!
value.excerpt: Have you noticed some extra queries being sent when using Incremental Refresh in Power BI? Patrick explains why this could happen and a potential workaround.
